it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.weapons

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.weapons.Weapon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WeaponWithAlternative, WeaponWithMultipleEffects

    public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the most basic type of weapon of the game, which only has a basic attack

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Attack activeAttack
      The Attack that is currently being executed
      protected java.util.List<Attack> availableAttacks
      A list of the attacks that can be executed by this weapon in the current situation
      protected Attack basicAttack
      The Basic Attack, which is the Attack all weapons must have
      protected Player currentShooter
      The Player that is currently using this weapon
      protected java.util.List<Attack> executedAttacks
      The attacks that have already been executed by the weapon during the current shoot
      protected Direction fixedDirection
      The Direction that this weapon can target in the current situation, or null all directions are available
      protected Interviewer interviewer
      The Interviewer that will be asked when there is a choice to make during the shooting session
      private java.lang.String name
      The weapon's name as a String.
      protected java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.Set<Player>,Attack>> previouslyHit
      The targets that have been damaged during the current shoot action.
      private Block startingBlock
      The Block from which Attacks executed by this weapon should start

      This constructor prepares the weapon so that it can be used

    • Field Detail

      • basicAttack

        protected final Attack basicAttack
        The Basic Attack, which is the Attack all weapons must have

      • activeAttack

        protected Attack activeAttack
        The Attack that is currently being executed

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        The weapon's name as a String. It is a unique identifier of the weapon

      • previouslyHit

        protected java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.Set<Player>,Attack>> previouslyHit
        The targets that have been damaged during the current shoot action. Each damaged set of targets is associated with the Attack that was used to deal the damage

      • startingBlock

        private Block startingBlock
        The Block from which Attacks executed by this weapon should start

      • currentShooter

        protected Player currentShooter
        The Player that is currently using this weapon

      • availableAttacks

        protected java.util.List<Attack> availableAttacks
        A list of the attacks that can be executed by this weapon in the current situation

      • executedAttacks

        protected java.util.List<Attack> executedAttacks
        The attacks that have already been executed by the weapon during the current shoot

      • fixedDirection

        protected Direction fixedDirection
        The Direction that this weapon can target in the current situation, or null all directions are available

      • interviewer

        protected Interviewer interviewer
        The Interviewer that will be asked when there is a choice to make during the shooting session

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(java.lang.String name,
              Attack basicAttack)
        This constructor prepares the weapon so that it can be used
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the weapon as a String
        basicAttack - the basic attack of the weapon

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This method gets the name of the weapon
        Returns:
        the name of the weapon as a String

      • shoot

        public final void shoot(Interviewer interviewer,
                        Player activePlayer)
        This method will execute the shooting action
        Parameters:
        interviewer - the Interviewer that should make the decisions when multiple choices are available
        activePlayer - the Player that is shooting the weapon

      • attackSelection

        protected void attackSelection()
        Selects an available attack so that it can be executed

      • attackExecution

        protected final void attackExecution()
        Executes the active attack

      • resetStatus

        protected void resetStatus(Player activePlayer,
                           Interviewer interviewer)
        Prepares the weapon for a new shooting session
        Parameters:
        activePlayer - the Player that is going to use this weapon

      • addHitTargets

        protected void addHitTargets(java.util.Set<Player> targets,
                             Attack attack)
        Adds targets to the targets hit by this weapon
        Parameters:
        targets - the targets to add
        attack - the Attack that was used to hit the targets

      • handlePayment

        protected final void handlePayment(Interviewer interviewer,
                                   Attack chosenAttack)
        Handles the payment of the selected attack
        Parameters:
        interviewer - the Interviewer that should make the decisions when multiple choices are available
        chosenAttack - the Attack that is being "bought"

      • getCurrentShooter

        protected Player getCurrentShooter()
        Returns the Player that is currently shooting the weapon, if present - this method should only be used within a shooting action
        Returns:
        the Player shooting the weapon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no one is shooting the weapon

      • getStartingPoint

        protected java.util.Optional<Block> getStartingPoint()
        Returns an Optional wrapping the Block that represents the starting point of the attacks of this weapon
        Returns:
        the value of startingBlock wrapped in an Optional

      • getAllTargets

        protected java.util.List<Player> getAllTargets()
        Returns a list of all the targets that were hit by this weapon during the current shooting action. The same target will appear in the list as many time as he was hit
        Returns:
        a List<Player> with all the players hit by the weapon

      • canAffordAttack

        protected final boolean canAffordAttack(Attack attack)
        Determines whether the currentShooter can or cannot afford an attack
        Parameters:
        attack - the Attack that should be evaluated
        Returns:
        true if the Attack is affordable, false if it isn't

      • hasAvailableAttacks

        public boolean hasAvailableAttacks(Player activePlayer)
        Determines whether the given activePlayer can execute any Attack in the current situation
        Parameters:
        activePlayer - the Player that wants to shoot this weapon
        Returns:
        true if activePlayer can execute at least one Attack, false otherwise

      • getExecutedAttacks

        protected java.util.List<Attack> getExecutedAttacks()
        Returns the attacks that have already been executed in the current shooting session
        Returns:
        a List<Attack> containing the executed attacks

      • canExecuteAttack

        protected final boolean canExecuteAttack(Attack attack)
        Determines whether an Attack can be executed
        Parameters:
        attack - the Attack to analyze
        Returns:
        true if attack can be executed, false if it cannot

      • wasHitBy

        public final java.util.Set<Player> wasHitBy(Attack attack)
        Returns the Set<Player> that were hit by attack. Even if attack hit a player more than once, he will only appear once in the result (as it is a Set)
        Parameters:
        attack - the Attack you want to know the victims of
        Returns:
        a Set<Player> containing the victime of attack

      • setStartingBlock

        protected void setStartingBlock(Block block)
        Sets the property startingBlock to the desired value
        Parameters:
        block - the new starting block

      • getActiveAttack

        protected Attack getActiveAttack()
        Gets the Attack that is currently being executed, if any
        Returns:
        the current active Attack
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Attack is being executed
